Title: Object: The Flight into Egypt
Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin carrying the sleeping infant Jesus swaddled in her cloak, with St Joseph walking beside her, carrying a staff and leading a donkey, gesturing to left towards a pool of water; rock landscape in the background; after Carle van Loo. Mezzotint with etching
Curator's comments: Possibly copied from the mezzotint in the same direction by J Johnson: see 2010,7081.664 for an impression. There is a reduced version published by Carington Bowles (2010,7081.1892) States [recorded in the Lennox-Boyd database] (i) lettered with the title, reference 'Joseph arose, & took the young child Jesus and his Mother, and departed into Egypt. // St. Matthew Ch II. v. 14.' and '16 // Published 12th. May, 1794, by Laurie & Whittle, 53, Fleet Street, London.' (ii) re-issued from a worn plate; the clump of foliage below St Joseph's right foot, and the stone below the Virgin's left foot, missing [impression with CLB]
Bibliographic references: Chaloner Smith 1883 / British Mezzotinto portraits from the introduction of the art to the early part of the present century (undescribed)
Russell 1926 / English Mezzotint Portraits and their states: Catalogue of Corrections of and Additions to Chaloner Smith's "British Mezzotinto Portraits" (undescribed)
